member.name: T:ADSD.SecurityConfig
member.summary: Config settings to create or verify an AAD JWT token

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.TennantKey
member.summary: Security tennant key. Must be the same across the AAD organisation.

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.AadAuthorityRoot
member.summary: Optional: Signing authority. Used only for generating tokens

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.ClientId
member.summary: Optional: Application ID from AAD instance Used only for generating tokens

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.AppKey
member.summary: Optional: Secret key owned by the Application in the AAD instance Used only for generating tokens

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.ResourceId
member.summary:
Optional: Resource ID being authorised. Used only for generating tokens.
In practice, this is the same as the `Audience` ID

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.Audience
member.summary: The required audience any token must be signed for. In practice, it's the same as the `ResourceID` used to create the token.

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.KeyDiscoveryUrl
member.summary:
X5C AAD signing key source.
For AAD, this is almost always "https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/discovery/keys"

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityConfig.AadTokenIssuer
member.summary:
URL Used to authenticate a security token
For AAD, this is almost always "https://sts.windows.net/"

member.name: T:ADSD.SecurityOutcome
member.summary: A simple pass or fail result for a token check

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityOutcome.Fail
member.summary: Security check failed

member.name: F:ADSD.SecurityOutcome.Pass
member.summary: Security check passed

member.summary: A caching store of JWT signing keys

member.name: F:ADSD.SigningKeys.KeyCache
member.summary: Map of kid=>x5c data

member.name: M:ADSD.SigningKeys.AllAvailableKeys
member.summary:
Return a disposable collection of security tokens for all known signing keys.
Caller must dispose

member.name: M:ADSD.SigningKeys.PublicKeyForKid(System.String)
member.summary:
Look up the Public Key for a given KID. KID is case sensitive. Returns `null` if no public key is found.
A new certificate is created for each call, and should be disposed by the caller

member.name: M:ADSD.SigningKeys.UpdateKeyCache(System.String)
member.summary: Update the key cache on a background thread. This method will return before the new keys are available.
